text: Michael Anthony Diaz (born April 15, 1960) is a former professional baseball player. He played all or part of four seasons in Major League Baseball between 1983 and 1988, for the Chicago Cubs, Pittsburgh Pirates and Chicago White Sox. He also played four seasons in Nippon Professional Baseball (NPB) from 1989 to 1992. After starting his career as a catcher, he split his time about equally between first base and the outfield. Following his major league career, he played four seasons in Japan, from 1989 until 1992, for the Lotte Orions (who in 1992 became the Chiba Lotte Marines). He was nicknamed "Rambo" there due to a perceived resemblance to Sylvester Stallone.Japan Baseball Daily foreign batters page, D through F In 1990, he became the first foreign player to catch a game in NPB in 12 years. ==References== ==External links== Category:1960 births Category:American expatriate baseball players in Japan Category:Baseball players from California Category:Chiba Lotte Marines players Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Geneva Cubs players Category:Gulf Coast Cubs players Category:Hawaii Islanders players Category:Iowa Cubs players Category:Living people Category:Lotte Orions players Category:Major League Baseball first basemen Category:Major League Baseball outfielders Category:Midland Cubs players Category:Nippon Professional Baseball designated hitters Category:Pittsburgh Pirates players Category:Portland Beavers players Category:Quad Cities Cubs players
